title: Nostradamus
summary: Michel de Nostredame (depending on the source, 14 or 21 December 1503 – 1 or 2 July 1566), usually Latinised as Nostradamus,[lower-alpha 1] was a French astrologer, physician and reputed seer, who is best known for his book Les Prophéties, a collection of 942 poetic quatrains[lower-alpha 2] allegedly predicting future events. The book was first published in 1555.
